{{Otheruses|Gelato (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Software | name = Gelato | logo=[[File:Gelato newlogo.png]]| screenshot = | caption = | developer = [[Nvidia|Nvidia Corporation]] | latest_release_version = 2.2 Release 1 | latest_release_date = May 2008 | operating_system = [[Windows XP]], [[Windows Vista]], [[Linux]] ([[Red Hat Linux|Red Hat]], [[SUSE Linux distributions|SUSE]] or [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]])| genre = [[3D computer graphics]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]], [[Freeware]] | website = [http://www.nvidia.com/page/gelato.html Nvidia's Gelato site] | }} '''Gelato''' is a [[Computer hardware|hardware]]-accelerated, [[Software rendering#Offline rendering|offline]] [[renderer]] created by [[graphics card]] manufacturer [[Nvidia]]. It was originally intended for use with its Quadro FX [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]], although a Quadro class GPU is no longer a requirement, as it now also supports [[GeForce]] cards. Designed to produce [[film]]-quality images, Gelato uses a [[Shader|shading language]] very similar to [[RenderMan Interface Specification|RenderMan's]]. Gelato was first released in April 2004. NVIDIA stated in May 2008 that it will no longer be developing or supporting the Gelato software products .<ref>{{cite web | url=http://blogs.nvidia.com/gelato/ | title = Official Nvidia Gelato Blog | date=2009-02-06 | accessdate = 2009-02-06 | publisher = Nvidia }}</ref>
With the release of Gelato 2.0, and in a push to popularize GPU accelerated rendering (as opposed to the traditional CPU rendering), Nvidia released a free version of Gelato for [[personal computers|PCs]]. Some of the more advanced features on this version were locked out, such as those used for production rendering. This was done to encourage more professional users to purchase the full product. However, on 23 May 2008, Nvidia released Gelato Pro as a free download without any additional license.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.nvidia.com/object/gz_buy_gzpro.html | title = Buy Gelato Pro | date=2008-08-11 | accessdate = 2008-08-11 | work = Gelato Pro | publisher = Nvidia |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080803160718/http://www.nvidia.com/object/gz_buy_gzpro.html |archivedate = 2008-08-03}}</ref> It does not come with support from Nvidia, but there are user forums. <!--==Gelato Free==-->
==History== The original renderer was priced at several thousand [[United States dollar]]s (USD) per node. In order to boost the adoption of the product by a wider user base, in late 2006, Nvidia decided to split the product up into two versions,{{Citation needed|date=June 2008}} a free version called Gelato and a professional version called Gelato Pro, which sold for 1,500 USD per render node. Gelato Pro is now also offered as a free download. The professional version includes the following extra features.
*Nvidia Sorbetto interactive relighting technology *DSO shadeops *Network [[parallel rendering]] *Multithreading *Native 64-bit support *Maintenance and support
The whole 'Gelato Zone', including Gelato Pro 2.2, was removed from Nvidia's website around the end of July 2008, in favour of the new [[CUDA]]-based [[OptiX]] ray tracing engine.
